Overall amazingly fun horror game. I usually don't care for many because I could careless for jump scares but this one you don't have to worry about a whole lot. Amazing with a group of 3-4 friends, I prefer 3 because then I can play as a survivor against a random killer. I love seeing all of the classic horror icons.

Great survival game!

I find myself at an impasse. I enjoy seeing peasants get fucked but also don't like seeing gore, like at all. DBD was softcore gore enough that I was able to play it with friends after some getting used to and I found a surprisingly deep skill system that nudges players into different playstyles. The skill system isn't overbearing to the point that it makes survivors unrecognizeable from each other, but it does let you swag on killers in a variety of ways.

Those interested in playing the killers, I never play that side so look elsewhere for a useful review.

its just not that fun anymore.
I bought this game at the 4th year aniversary and luckily got the game w dlc's at a lower price. Its not a game worth full price, theres so much miscomunication between devs and community that its just frustrating for both parties. I'm seeing a pattern that as soon as the community starts to whine, the devs feed them a new character, new skins or even a new chaper/dlc. I think they're putting their money into the wrong department.

The game itself is quite buggy, kinda toxic and you gotta be lucky to find a cooperative team or a group of survivors that doesn't want to bully you as soon as they see you. The Rank system is kind of weird rn the same goes for the Matchmaking system, its... interesting. The game gets kind of boring after the first 100h, its always the same concept and you don't get that scared anymore, of course I do sometimes get jumpscared or nervous/excited in a chase but that is a one in 7 games chance. With the overall unique game and weird fanbase all I can say is, is that IF you do decide to buy the game, wait for a sale or a good deal w some dlc's otherwise its not worth the mony.


(Also I hate Nemesis, its a killer that I'd just dc against because he's no fun to go against and the RCPD map is sooo bad. Coming to the terms of maps, why are they putting so much details in these maps? The amount of times I get stuck at some of those dumb details and loose the chase over is depressing and annoying)
Nah
Wait till chris redfield gets his box.

If you're looking for an enjoyable casual experience, you may be disappointed. Dead By Daylight is a 4vs1 competitive horror game simulation that has very few decent lookalikes on the market. However, the game itself fits a small niche and I wouldn't recommend it for those who aren't ready to prepare a large chunk of time out of their day, or week at worst, for learning the insides and outs of the game mechanics. Understanding the mindset of your opponent(s) can be important as well, if not vital. For example, a survivor's chances of escape are slim if they don't catch on to certain patterns of the killer that pursues them.

The game's community/playerbase is another subject that might turn away a purchase. Unsportsmanlike conduct and toxic behavior is to be expected on occasion, considering the competitive nature of the game. These sometimes include strategies that can range from debated to highly controversial, like body-blocking. NOT EVERY match involves issues like these; even when there's no communication at all postgame, there will be players who would rather start another match instead of arguing. 

TLDR: I don't recommend this if you're looking for a casual experience in a competitive game. If you're interested in character progression with a varied roster on both sides, coming up with viable builds using a four perk system, and overcoming a massive gap between skill floor and ceiling, then you'll likely enjoy Dead by Daylight. Maybe even more if you're a horror fan that wants to see famous horror icons compiled in one game.
